org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors

Class AbstractPollingCursor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors.AbstractCursor<T>
      • org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors.AbstractPollingCursor<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<T>, Cursor<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LineCursor

    public abstract class AbstractPollingCursor<T>
extends AbstractCursor<T>

    An extension of AbstractCursor that simplifies the mechanics of the next()/hasNext() implementation to a simple method, poll().

    Compatibility
    Public

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractPollingCursor()
      Construct a cursor of unknown size.
      AbstractPollingCursor(int rowCount)
      Construct a cursor with a known number of rows.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Description copied from interface: Cursor

        Query whether the cursor has any more items. If the cursor or underlying source has been closed, this may return even if the end has not been reached.

        Returns:
        true if there remains another item to fetch.

      • next

        @Nonnull
public T next()
        Description copied from interface: Cursor

        Fetch the next item from the cursor.

        Returns:
        The next item in the cursor.

      • poll

        protected abstract T poll()

        Return the next element in this Cursor, or null if there are no more elements. This must be safe to call multiple times at the end of its collection.

        Change in 3.0: Previously, this method was allowed to return the same object repeatedly, mutated to represent the next result. This is no longer permitted.

        Returns:
        The next element, or null.
